solution_line_template: So first, we should add the prices of all salons. At Gustran Salon, the total price is: ${gustran_haircut_price} + ${gustran_facial_price} + ${gustran_nails_price} = $<<{gustran_haircut_price}+{gustran_facial_price}+{gustran_nails_price}={gustran_total_price}>>{gustran_total_price}

The total price at Barbara's shop is: ${barbara_nails_price} + ${barbara_haircut_price} + ${barbara_facial_price} = $<<{barbara_nails_price}+{barbara_haircut_price}+{barbara_facial_price}={barbara_total_price}>>{barbara_total_price}

The total price at The Fancy Salon is: ${fancy_facial_price} + ${fancy_haircut_price} + ${fancy_nails_price} = $<<{fancy_facial_price}+{fancy_haircut_price}+{fancy_nails_price}={fancy_total_price}>>{fancy_total_price}

At Gustran salon she would spend ${gustran_total_price}, at Barbara's Shop she would spend ${barbara_total_price}, and at The Fancy Salon she would spend ${fancy_total_price}, so she would spend ${cheapest_price} at the cheapest salon.
